Media.MediaTitle: skin cancer, melanoma stage IA and IB

ImageData.LabelName: Tumor is more than 1 mm but not more than 2 mm

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.SourceFilename: MelanomaStage1A FP III Stage1B FP IV.1.jpg
OriginalSource.Comment: For stage IA, updated skin tone to FP III; for stage IB, updated skin tone to FP IV
Removed the bracket between 1-2 mm on the left-hand panel
Revisions made to image per AJCC 8th edition staging

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Two-panel drawing of stage I melanoma; the panel on the left shows a stage IA tumor that is not more than 1 millimeter thick, with ulceration (a break in the skin) and without ulceration. The panel on the right shows a stage IB tumor that is more than 1 but not more than 2 millimeters thick, without ulceration. Also shown are the epidermis (outer layer of the skin), the dermis (inner layer of the skin), and the subcutaneous tissue below the dermis.

Two-panel drawing of stage I melanoma; the panel on the left shows a stage IA tumor that is not more than 1 millimeter thick, with ulceration (a break in the skin) and without ulceration. The panel on the right shows a stage IB tumor that is more than 1 but not more than 2 millimeters thick, without ulceration. Also shown are the epidermis (outer layer of the skin), the dermis (inner layer of the skin), and the subcutaneous tissue below the dermis.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage I melanoma. In stage IA, the tumor is not more than 1 millimeter thick, with or without ulceration (a break in the skin). In stage IB, the tumor is more than 1 but not more than 2 millimeters thick, without ulceration. Skin thickness is different on different parts of the body.

Stage I melanoma. In stage IA, the tumor is not more than 1 millimeter thick, with or without ulceration (a break in the skin). In stage IB, the tumor is more than 1 but not more than 2 millimeters thick, without ulceration. Skin thickness is different on different parts of the body.

ProcessingStatus.ProcessingStatusValue: Approved by expert reviewer with changes
ProcessingStatus.Comment: Recommendations: Emphasize junction of epidermis & dermis. Divide dermis into papillary dermis & reticular dermis. Change label from "fatty tissue" to "subcutaneous layer".
2008-10-15 revised to match recent summary text changes.
2008-08-28 added epidermis & dermis to content desc.
2008-07-31 revised beg. of caption/content to read "stage I melanoma" rather than IA, IB - consistent with other staging illustrations.
2008-07-28 caption and content desc approved w/ edits; rh.
